intro: Litothamnus saundersiae, commonly known as the Saunders' rock-honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Litothamnus saundersiae is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
